Gourmet and the Oltan: The odd tale of a heart and a monster
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 3 Archive (PS2): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Gourmet and the Oltan: The odd tale of a heart and a monster
By Bloodluvingirl on Thursday, September 18, 2003 - 12:29 pm:

Okay, I wasn't sure where this should go so I started a new thread.

Well anyways, I was raising a Ogyo and it developed the trait 'Gourmet'. I did eveything I could to get rid of this annoying characteristic but by the time my monster died she still had it. I was happy to see that it didn't show upon the heart though.

So I decided to raise a Goat Gitan next and I gave it the heart, and no gourmet. So I kept on playing but I found out that the orb I had grabbed was the same as the move my gitan got from the heart. Now I wanted to start out with four moves so I loaded my second save that I made right before I gave it the heart and froze it. I brought out another monster and decided to us it to find a bunch of stones and orbs and then use them on some of my favorite monsters, keeping them frozen in the meantime.

Well part way through this I decided to test my hearts out on some of the monsters to see which hearts would work best with each monster. I ended up finding my ogyo's heart worked best on my gitan, but now no matter how many times I reloaded and gave the heart to him he would get gourmet. Even though it wasn't listed on the heart. I knew it hadn't given that trait before so I was a little upset at this, because otherwise it was a great heart.

So I gave up and didn't use any hearts, went back to getting orbs and played until that monster got what I needed and died.

I pulled out my gitan and decided to try the heart again and found out that gourmet had dissapeared. Even reloading abunch of times to make sure I got another trait didn't make it show up at all.

Well I'm not sure if this info will help you but I thought that some of you might find this observation interesting, and maybe even helpful.

By Toa3t on Thursday, September 18, 2003 - 07:31 pm:

You do know it's better to use the Orb that gives the Heart's skill before the heart itself is given, right?

Say... you raise a Dragon, its forte is a maxed Salamander (let's say that comes from a Fire Orb). Then, if you give a Fire Orb to a monster BEFORE the heart, the monster will have the Fire Orb tech maxed. This is better than having a level one tech by a long shot.

Oh, and for what you say: sounds about right, no one really knows how characteristics are passed in specific terms, and it's been reported before that they can skip generations if the heart is "full."

-Kevin
